sentence.value: Michael John "Bloomer" Bloomfield (born 16 March 1959) is a former American astronaut and a veteran of three Space Shuttle missions.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Michael John|Michael_John]] "Bloomer" Bloomfield (born 16 [[March 1959|March_1959]]) is [[a former American astronaut|The_American_Astronaut]] and [[a veteran|Veteran]] of three [[Space|Space]] [[Shuttle missions|List_of_space_shuttle_missions]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Michael John "Bloomer" Bloomfield (born 16 March 1959) is a former American astronaut and a veteran of three Space Shuttle missions.

sentence.value: Born in Flint and raised in Lake Fenton, Michigan, Bloomfield received his bachelor's degree in Engineering Mechanics from the United States Air Force Academy, where he played Falcons football for coach Bill Parcells and was the team's captain.
sentence.tree: ccomp(received/VBD-13,Born/VBN-1) prep_in(Born/VBN-1,Flint/NNP-3) conj_and(Born/VBN-1,raised/VBN-5) ccomp(received/VBD-13,raised/VBN-5) nn(Fenton/NN-8,Lake/NNP-7) prep_in(raised/VBN-5,Fenton/NN-8) nn(Bloomfield/NNP-12,Michigan/NNP-10) nsubj(received/VBD-13,Bloomfield/NNP-12) poss(bachelor/NN-15,his/PRP$-14) poss(degree/NN-17,bachelor/NN-15) dobj(received/VBD-13,degree/NN-17) nn(Mechanics/NNPS-20,Engineering/NNP-19) prep_in(received/VBD-13,Mechanics/NNPS-20) det(Academy/NNP-27,the/DT-22) nn(Academy/NNP-27,United/NNP-23) nn(Academy/NNP-27,States/NNP-24) nn(Academy/NNP-27,Air/NNP-25) nn(Academy/NNP-27,Force/NNP-26) prep_from(received/VBD-13,Academy/NNP-27) advmod(played/VBD-31,where/WRB-29) nsubj(played/VBD-31,he/PRP-30) nsubj(was/VBD-39,he/PRP-30) advcl(received/VBD-13,played/VBD-31) iobj(played/VBD-31,Falcons/NNPS-32) dobj(played/VBD-31,football/NN-33) nn(Parcells/NNP-37,coach/NN-35) nn(Parcells/NNP-37,Bill/NNP-36) prep_for(football/NN-33,Parcells/NNP-37) advcl(received/VBD-13,was/VBD-39) conj_and(played/VBD-31,was/VBD-39) det(team/NN-41,the/DT-40) poss(captain/NN-43,team/NN-41) dobj(played/VBD-31,captain/NN-43)

sentence.value: He became an F-15 fighter pilot with the rare combination of having graduated the Fighter Weapons Instructor Course (FWIC, pronounced 'Fwick') and then selected as a test pilot (assigned to the F-16 test squadron at Edwards AFB).

sentence.value: Selected by NASA in December 1994, Bloomfield reported to the Johnson Space Center in March 1995.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Selected by [[NASA|NASA]] in [[December 1994|1994]], Bloomfield reported to [[the Johnson Space Center|Lyndon_B._Johnson_Space_Center]] in [[March 1995|1995]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Selected by [[NASA|NASA]] in December 1994, Bloomfield reported to [[the Johnson Space Center|Lyndon_B._Johnson_Space_Center]] in March 1995.

sentence.value: He worked as Chief of Safety for the Astronaut Office, Chief Instructor Astronaut, Director of Shuttle Operations, and Chief of the Shuttle Branch, which oversees all Shuttle technical issues for the Astronaut Office.

sentence.value: He first flew as a pilot aboard STS-86 in 1997, where he docked with the space station Mir.
sentence.annotated-sentence: He first flew as a pilot aboard [[STS-86|STS-86]] in [[1997|1997]], where he docked with [[the space station Mir|Mir]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: He first flew as a pilot aboard [[STS-86|STS-86]] in 1997, where he docked with the space station Mir.

sentence.value: Bloomfield also piloted STS-97 in 2000 and commanded STS-110 in 2002, both missions to the International Space Station.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Bloomfield also piloted [[STS-97|STS-97]] in [[2000|2000]] and commanded [[STS-110|STS-110]] in [[2002|2002]], both missions to [[the International Space Station|International_Space_Station]].

sentence.value: Bloomfield has served as Deputy Director of Flight Crew Operations at NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas since 2006, before resigning from NASA in July 2007.
